trans-unit.source: Represents the exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to invoke an invalid target.
A `TargetException` is thrown when an attempt is made to invoke a non-static method on a null object.
This may occur because the caller does not have access to the member, or because the target does not define the member, and so on.
This exception is not included in the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the , but it is thrown by some members that are.
To catch the exception in that case, write a `catch` statement for <xref:System.Exception> instead.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Reflection.TargetException"></xref> class with an empty message and the root cause of the exception.
The `InnerException` property is set to `null` and the HRESULT error code is set to COR_E_TARGET.
`TargetException` inherits from the <xref:System.Exception>.
This constructor sets the properties of the `Exception` object as shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The empty string ("").
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Reflection.TargetException"></xref> class with the given message and the root cause exception.
`TargetException` inherits from the <xref:System.Exception>.
This constructor sets the properties of the `Exception` object as shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The message string.
A `String` describing the reason why the exception occurred.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Reflection.TargetException"></xref> class with the specified serialization and context information.
The data for serializing or deserializing the object.
The source of and destination for the object.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Reflection.TargetException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Reflection.TargetException>.
Property
Value
The inner exception reference.
The error message string.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the inner parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
